Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of parts of crescents, alternating black and added red; to the outside, broad band between sets of lines; exterior: part of wide red band above three narrow bands; below, stylised pomegranate frieze, below, two band and glazed area.
Curator's comments: This sherd has been attributed to the Hephaistos Painter, who has been renamed the Boreads Painter, see Lane 1933-1934. For parallels regarding the pattern see a sherd from Miletus, C.M. Stibbe, Lakonische Vasenmaler des Sechsten Jahrhunderts V. Chr. Supplement. Mainz 2004, pl. 17, no. 87.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.3)
